lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, :accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
* A personal assistant chatbot that helps users keep track of tasks to complete.
// Write tasks data to storage before terminating program
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, TODO, EVENT, DEADLINE, FIND
* DukeException represents exceptions thrown by the Duke program.
* Constructs a new DukeException with a message.
* Deals with making sense of the user's commands.
* Constructs the Parser object given an input string.
* Parses the user input to get the command and its arguments.
* @throws DukeException if the input cannot be parsed.
throw new DukeException("Please enter a command!");
throw new DukeException("Input format: mark (task number)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: mark (task number)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: unmark (task number)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: unmark (task number)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: delete (task number)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: delete (task number)");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Input format: event (event name) \\at (event date/time)");
throw new DukeException("Input format: deadline (deadline name) \\by (YYYY-MM-DD)");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Deals with loading tasks from the hard disk and saving tasks in the hard disk.
* If there's no existing directory or file, a new directory and/or file is created.
// dataFile is used as the input source of the Scanner
* Writes Task data from the Duke chatbot to hard disk.
* If there's no existing directory or file, a new directory and/or file is created.
* @param data The Task data to be written to hard disk.
* Represents tasks that have to be done by a specific deadline.
* @param name the name of the deadline.
* @param date the date of the deadline.
* @throws DukeException when date is not formatted properly.
public Deadline(String name, String date) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Please use this format for the deadline: YYYY-MM-DD");
* @param name   the name of the deadline.
* @param date   the date of the deadline.
* @param isDone the status of the deadline.
public Deadline(String name, String date, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a Deadline instance from its string representation.
* @param inputString the string representation of the Deadline.
* Represents tasks that have a start and end time.
* @param name     the name of the event.
* @param duration the duration of the event.
* @param name     the name of the event.
* @param duration the duration of the event.
* @param isDone   the status of the event.
public Event(String name, String duration, boolean isDone) {
* Returns an Event instance from its string representation.
* @param inputString the string representation of the Task.
* Abstract class representing tasks that the user needs to complete.
* Tasks have an incomplete status by default.
* @param name the name of the task.
* @param name   the name of the task.
* @param isDone the status of the task.
* @return true if keyword is found in name.
* Returns a concrete Task instance from its string representation.
* @param inputString the string representation of the Task.
* Represents the list of Tasks in the Duke program.
* Constructs a TaskList given an ArrayList of Task instances.
* Adds a Task to the end of the TaskList.
* @param task the task to be added.
* @param index the index of the task.
* @param index the index of the task.
* Returns true if this TaskList contains no Tasks.
* @return returns true if this TaskList contains no Tasks.
* Finds all Tasks which match a given keyword.
* Prints the tasks in the list, with their indices starting from 1.
* Converts TaskList to a string that is formatted to be written to Storage.
* Represents tasks without any date/time attached to it.
* @param name the name of the todo.
* @param name   the name of the todo.
* @param isDone the status of the todo
* Returns a Todo instance from its string representation.
* @param inputString the string representation of the Todo.
* Deals with interactions with the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke" + "\nHow can I help you?");
System.out.println("Great! This task is completed:\n" + task);
System.out.println("Okay, this task is now unchecked:\n" + task);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + task);
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + task);
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
assertEquals("Input format: event (event name) \\at (event date/time)", e.getMessage());
